Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2012 03:22PM LWachsmuth wrote: You might want to ask your doctor about BSGI. I saw it on TV and it's supposed to be a great tool to find out for sure if you have cancer or not.
Posts.Title: Not sure what to do SLDS GODISGOOD2012

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2012 03:38PM LWachsmuth wrote: Breast-Specific Gamma Imaging/Molecular Breast Imaging (BSGI/MBI) is a molecular breast imaging procedure that shows the metabolic activity of breast lesions independent of breast density. BSGI/MBI is technology that is complementary to mammography and ultrasound and is clinically proven to improve breast cancer detection and treatment planning when used in combination with these modalities. They my not have it, but might know where it is.
Posts.Title: Not sure what to do SLDS GODISGOOD2012

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2012 03:48PM LWachsmuth wrote: Since MRI seems to have a lot of false positives, has anyone looked into BSGI. It's a new technology that's supposed to be better than MRI.

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2012 03:57PM LWachsmuth wrote: Sorry I got sidetracked. BSGI means Breast Specific Gamma Imaging and MBI is Molecular Breast Imaging. If you google them, you can learn all about it. From what I've been reading, it sounds like they're both the same thing.
